meanings.definition: Lack of an adequate amount or quality
meanings.sent1: The insufficiency of food made him feel hungry all the time.
meanings.sent2: The insufficiency of funds prevented the project from moving forward.
meanings.sent3: The insufficiency of jokes in the comedy show left the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her insufficiency of sleep turned her into a walking zombie.
meanings.sent5: The insufficiency of water in the desert was a matter of life and death.

meanings.sent1: The insufficiency of resources hindered the team's progress.
meanings.sent2: She felt the insufficiency of support from her friends during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The insufficiency of sugar in the recipe made the cake taste strange.
meanings.sent4: His insufficiency of courage prevented him from speaking up for himself.
meanings.sent5: The insufficiency of evidence led to the case being dismissed.
